title: E-Learning Competency Enhancement: Spline Adaptive Filtering Techniques for Nonlinear System Identification

context.prior_knowledge: Linear systems theory, basic signal processing knowledge, and numerical analysis experience using MATLAB/Python
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: The principles of spline-based filtering algorithms for solving nonlinear system identification problems can be explained

Learners design an algorithm combining LHC (Lossless Hashing Cost) cost function and MNAG (Multi-Noise Adaptive Gradient) learning method in impulsive noise environments, achieving over 90% noise removal accuracy through 10+ repeated simulations in MATLAB/Python environments

Learners apply three or more algorithms (neural networks, support vector machines, Gaussian processes) to real nonlinear hysteresis systems (e.g., piezoelectric actuators) in MATLAB/Simulink environments, producing quantitative evaluation results with cross-validated RMSE ≤0.15 and R² ≥0.95
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
